title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Hi, I have this board from another shop. It is very clean. Nothing visually wrong with it as of now. Dont think it even had liquid damage. Without battery green light turns amber after a couple seconds. I dont know much more as of yet. Im getting this in now in case you see this so I have an idea what to look for in the morning. I do know I have all G3H, PP3V42, PP18VDCIN, PPVRTC (16.5V) and PP5V_S5 & PP3V3_S5. I also know Im missing S4 power.Possible SMC issue most likely because of amber light? Thank you, have a good
night/day.


Update 1 - Missing PP5V-S4. Missing P5V_S4_EN.

U7970

pn 6 - 3.3V
pn 2 - Low (0V)
pn 1 - (SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN) Missing.

SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN Diode mode - .667
L4901 3.4V


Udate 2 -

Tried reflow on SMC. No change.
Reballed SMC - No Change.


Thanks.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Just messing around without diagnosing anything?

First measure PPBUS and PPVRTC and report exact values here. Also inspect the common corrosion points on these, U1900, U1950 pin 8, U6100 and termination resistors. Check for power cycling on 5V_S4 preferably with a scope.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
the charger light is amber while charging battery or lacking one entirely by design on these.

Edit*** therefore... The orange light is arbitrary.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: No battery. Thanks.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Sorry. To clarify... Someone correct me if I'm wrong, but these models have an orange light present whether there is a battery installed or not. The only time the light will hold solid green is WITH a battery when fully charged. The orange light alone the way you're describing isn't enough indicate the smc.

BTW what is the problem you're experiencing here anyway,? they need to understand what it is you're aiming to solve.



 Always deferred to the expert above- what voltages are present on the rails Duke requested.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Yeah... I just like re-balling shit...

Honestly I thought since I was missing SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN for P5V3V3_S4_EN that SMC would be possibility since thats where it comes from and i may as well try it. PPBUS is 12.56V and PPVRTC is fluctuates from 16.18 to 16.435V. I'm assuming you meant U2600 and U2650? U2600/50 both look good .99 to .107 on pin 8 U2650. No power cycling on P5V_S4. U6100 looks good. R5021 - 24Ohm, R5022 - 43Ohm, R5023 - 15Ohm R5024 - 15Ohm.
Thanks Duke.

[USER="893"]2andrewd[/USER] -
Thank you. I didnt know that the orange light stays on with or without battery. Problem I am experiencing is no power/fan spin. Missing P5V_S4.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: If there really is 16v on PPVRTC this board is totally fried, check what you are measuring, should never be more than 3.4V.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Your right. Sorry I miss typed. That was PPDC-IN Didnt eat today. Get back to you with that. Thanks have a good one.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
PPBUSG3H - 12.56V
PP3V42 - 3.4V
PPVRTC is 3.33V
PPDCIN -  fluctuates 16.18 to 16.43V
PP5V_S5 - 5V
PP5V_S4 - .001
PP5V_S3 - MISSING
PP3V3_S5 - 3.33V
PP3V3_S4 - 0.44
PP3V3_S3 - 0.004

PIN 8 U2650.  I plug in the charger and take measurement. At first it climbs to 0.110V then slowly drains to around -0.015V  then slowly start to climb again. Repeats this. How am I getting anything on 3V3_S3 without any other ones? 

Thanks Duke. Have a good day.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Let's see if we can get all s5 rails before looking into FireWire/ether net. The reading on s3 is negligible.

Voltage on pm_slp_s4_l ?

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Hi. Thanks for response. I have 0V on pm_slp_s4_l. Measured on pin 1 of R2805. Thanks again.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Did you come across any corrosion or tell tales?

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: no. none at all. I wish. :)

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Voltage drop to ground  on pm_slp_s4_l in diode mode?

Voltage on smc_on_off_l?

u6100 termination resistors within spec? Traces between intact?

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: I bet the machine is power cycling seeing the DCIN voltage is going up and down. Measure carefully on 5V_S4 preferably with a scope as a multimeter is too slow to catch the short pulses.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
Duke. I waited like 5 minutes on the PP5V_S4 with multi meter. stayed at .001. i dont have scope. If it is cycling and I cant catch it. Anything I can do. (besides buy a scope) :rolleyes:

Ill take your bet.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Thanks Duke and Andrew

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Check the usual U1950 pin 8, U1900, U6100 and termination resistors and traces to it. Shorts on all rails?

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
U1950, U1900? Do you mean something else? I dont have in boardview or schematic.


U2600, U2650?


​​​​​​​Thanks

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Google is your friend.  Disregard, I misread your post.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message:
im going with 2600 & 2650


pm_slp_s4_l in diode. .470

3.4V on SMC_ON_OFF_L

Termination resistors U6100. Im assuming these are them.

R5120 43 OHM
R5121 43 OHM
R5122 43 OHM
R5123 24 OHM

R5110 15 OHM
R5111 15 OHM
R5112 15 OHM

pin 8 U2650 .070V to -.009V (cycles)

When you say check for shorts on ALL rails Do you mean sub rails as well?

If Im wrong please correct me. Thank you for your time.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: Try U7950 and U2600 rather.

message:
ok. I have 3.3V on pin 8 of U7950.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: SMC_ADAPTER_EN present? PM_DSW_PWRGD present?

message:
Hey.

SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.3V.   PM_DSW_PWRGD 1.5 V. Thanks. Have a good one.

title: 820-3462 Amber light
message: DSW_PWRGD is not ok. If S5_PWRGD is present then it could be a SMC or CPU/PCH issue.
